title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death, Nora Seed finds a library where she can try out different lives she might have lived, exploring paths she didn't take.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family in the mountains of Idaho to pursue an education.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
description: After witnessing the fatal shooting of her childhood best friend by a police officer, a 16-year-old girl navigates the complexities of her two worlds.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: An amnesiac astronaut wakes up on a spaceship with a mission to save humanity, but he can't remember who he is or how he got there.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping history of humankind from the Stone Age to the 21st century, exploring how we came to believe in gods, nations, and human rights.

title: One of Us Is Lying
author: Karen M. McManus
description: Five students walk into detention, but only four walk out alive. Everyone is a suspect, and everyone has something to hide.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A story of a young girl who raises herself in the marshes of North Carolina, becoming entangled in a murder investigation.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones, offering practical strategies for lasting change.

title: Crescent City: House of Earth and Blood
author: Sarah J. Maas
description: In a world brimming with magic and danger, a half-Fae, half-human woman seeks revenge and uncovers a conspiracy.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: A deeply personal memoir from the former First Lady of the United States, sharing her journey from childhood to the White House.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, teenagers are forced to fight to the death in a televised event, and one girl's defiance sparks a rebellion.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: A retelling of the Greek myth of Circe, the goddess of magic, as she navigates her immortal life and encounters legendary figures.

title: Factfulness
author: Hans Rosling
description: A book that challenges our common misconceptions about the world and offers a fact-based worldview.

title: A Good Girl's Guide to Murder
author: Holly Jackson
description: A high school senior investigates a closed murder case for her capstone project, uncovering dark secrets in her small town.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: Twin sisters choose to live in two very different worlds, one passing as white, the other living with her Black daughter, exploring themes of identity and race.

title: The Body Keeps the Score
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: A groundbreaking work on the effects of trauma and innovative treatments for recovery, drawing on neuroscience and clinical practice.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic American novel set in the Deep South during the 1930s, addressing themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The poignant and powerful diary of a young Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis during World War II.

title: Divergent
author: Veronica Roth
description: In a futuristic Chicago, society is divided into five factions. A young girl discovers she is Divergent and doesn't fit into any one group.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut is left behind on Mars and must use his ingenuity to survive and signal Earth.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Nobel laureate Daniel Kahneman explores the two systems that drive the way we think and make decisions.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two teenage cancer patients fall in love, navigating life, illness, and the complexities of their relationship.

title: Onyx Storm
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The third installment in The Empyrean series, following Violet Sorrengail as she faces escalating challenges in a world of dragon riders and political intrigue.

title: Broken Country
author: Clare Leslie Hall
description: A narrative exploring themes of love, loss, and resilience in a rural setting, delving into the lives of its complex characters.

title: Careless People
author: Sarah Wynn-Williams
description: A memoir detailing the author's experiences working at Facebook, offering insights into the tech industry's culture.

title: Resolute
author: Benjamin Hall
description: A personal account of the author's recovery after being injured while reporting in Ukraine.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A shocking psychological thriller about a famous painter who shoots her husband and a psychotherapist determined to unravel what happened.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd who journeys to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure, learning about himself along the way.

title: Educated: A Memoir
author: Tara Westover
description: A powerful memoir of self-invention, chronicling a young woman's journey from a fundamentalist upbringing to Cambridge University.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
description: A powerful story of two sisters struggling to survive and resist during the German occupation of France in World War II.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: In a seemingly utopian society, a young boy is chosen to be the receiver of memories, uncovering the dark truths about his community.

title: Where the Forest Meets the Stars
author: Glendy Vanderah
description: A grieving astronomer encounters a mysterious child who claims to be an alien, leading to a journey of healing and discovery.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: A counterintuitive approach to living a good life, challenging conventional self-help advice.

title: Red, White & Royal Blue
author: Casey McQuiston
description: The First Son of the United States falls in love with a British prince, navigating their secret romance amidst public scrutiny.

title: The Testaments
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A sequel to 'The Handmaid's Tale,' picking up fifteen years after Offred's final scene, with three female narrators.

title: The mind illuminated
author: Culadasa John Yates, Matthew Immergut PhD, Sean Runnette Jeremy Graves
description: A revolutionary, science-based approach to meditation from a neuroscientist turned meditation master, The Mind Illuminated is an accessible, step-by-step toolkit for anyone looking to start—or improve—their daily meditation practice.

title: Daphne's Questionable Bet
author: Sara Jo Cluff
description: When Daphne moves to California, her new nemesis dares her to a challenge: who can land the charming, popular Bentley Anderson as a prom date? Confident and competitive, Daphne jumps at the bet. Both girls pull out all the stops—flirting, scheming, and sabotage included. Bentley seems to be falling for Daphne… but she finds herself drawn to someone else. A sweet, awkward guy obsessed with superheroes—just like her.
